title: How To Talk on a Radio (or Walkie Talkie)

steps.title: First, decide who your dispatcher or secretary is.
steps.content: First, decide who your dispatcher or secretary is. The dispatcher is the person who sends out the calls to a person for what ever event. Label or Nick-Name this person BASE. This Will come in handy later.

steps.title: Give all the users a radio and a Nick-Name.
steps.content: Give all the users a radio and a Nick-Name. By Nick-Name, do not label people Momma-bear or Papa-Bear. Remember, you are trying to sound Professional.

steps.title: When you want to call BASE, you simply say "[your nick-name] to BASE."
steps.content: When you want to call BASE, you simply say "[your nick-name] to BASE." Example: "Packaging Dept. to BASE."

steps.title: When your nick-name is being called, you say :
steps.content: When your nick-name is being called, you say : "Go Ahead".

steps.title: The Calling person says or asks what they want to say/ask.
steps.content: The Calling person says or asks what they want to say/ask.

steps.title: After the conversation is done, the person who called the other person has the option to say and ONLY SAY:
steps.content: After the conversation is done, the person who called the other person has the option to say and ONLY SAY: "Clear" The other person can repeat this ONLY once.

steps.title: To call someone other than BASE, just say something like this:
steps.content: To call someone other than BASE, just say something like this: [Packaging Dept to Josh] - Josh will then say ["Go Ahead'].

steps.title: Go Ahead simply means "I'm ready to hear what you want to say".
steps.content: Go Ahead simply means "I'm ready to hear what you want to say".

steps.title: BASE:
steps.content: BASE: I need you to come to the front desk to sign a package that just arrived.
